intro: Morisonia bonifaziana, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and twining stems. The plant produces bright blue or violet flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Morisonia bonifaziana is also known for its rapid growth and ability to climb or trail along vegetation.
